title: Implement jit doc check-links
description:
Implement link validation to detect broken links and assets before archival operations.

## Rationale

Moving documents can break links if not careful. Need validation to detect issues before archival and provide confidence that links remain intact.

## Acceptance Criteria

### 1. Implement jit doc check-links

Command: jit doc check-links [--scope all|issue:ID] [--json]

Functionality:
- Validate all documents in scope
- Check asset existence (working tree or git)
- Validate internal doc links resolve
- Detect broken relative vs root-relative links
- Warn on potential issues, don't fail unless severe

Validation checks:
- Asset existence
- Asset reachability  
- Internal doc links
- Relative path safety

Human-readable output shows summary with errors and warnings.
JSON output provides structured results for automation.

### 2. Scope Options

- --scope all: Check all documents
- --scope issue:ID: Check only docs for specific issue
- Default: all

### 3. Exit Codes

- 0: All documents valid
- 1: Errors found (missing assets, broken links)
- 2: Only warnings (potential issues)

### 4. Integration Tests

- Check doc with all valid links
- Check doc with missing assets
- Check doc with broken internal links
- Check doc with risky relative links
- Scope filtering works
- JSON output validates

### 5. Documentation

- Help text with examples
- User guide section
- Include in authoring conventions

## Dependencies

- Task 9: jit doc assets commands

## Success Metrics

- Validation catches broken links
- Helpful error messages with suggestions
- JSON output for automation
- Tests cover edge cases
